info.title: TPN Business Payments API
info.description:
The Business Payments API allows Trustlink Payment Network compatible business the following features:
* Generation of a payment request to be actioned by any Masterpass or Trustlink Payment Network compatible app.

schema.title: Trustlink Payment Network Payment Request
schema.description: Request payload to generate a Trustlink Payment Network payment token

payeeRefInfo.description: Used to uniquely identify thetransaction for the applicable Member as usedinthe external system.

description.description: Description for the transaction. Will be displayed to the scanner of the QR code.

amount.description:
Amount to generate the payment token for. The amount will be displayed to the token reader in order for payer to confirm. If omitted, the payer can populate their own amount.
(Format R.cc / R)

expiryTime.description:
The expiry date and time of the resulting payment request token code. If not specified, then never expire.
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ).

dueDate.description:
Informational field indicating the date by when the payment is due.
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-dd)

payeeCategory1.description: User field to categorize the transaction.

payeeCategory2.description: User field to categorize the transaction.

payeeCategory3.description: User field to categorize the transaction.

siteRefInfo.description: "A reference used by the payee / external system to identify the specific business unit.

siteName.description: Used to identify the site that created the token request.

useOnce.description: Indicator to specify if the resulting token can be used once only or multiple times.

requestTip.description: Indicator for payee to specify if tip must be requested.

requestTokenImage.description: Indicator for payee to specify if image of token must be provided (in base64 encodedformat)

tokenImageSize.description:
The dimensions of the token image requiredin pixels. * LARGE(1024x1024px)
* MEDIUM(512x512px)
* SMALL(256x256px)

payeeAccountUuid.description: Payee account UUID in the Trustlink Payment Network. Searchable.

allOf.title: CHIPS Payment Token Object
allOf.description: Model for a payment token in the CHIPS system

requestTip.description:
Indicator for payee to specify if tip must be requested.
If omitted in the request, this will be returned with the default of false.

useOnce.description:
Indicator to specify if the resulting token can be used once only or multiple times.
If omitted in the request, this will be returned with the default of false.

siteName.description: Used to identify the site that created the token request.

siteRefInfo.description: A reference used by the payee / external system to identify the specific business unit.

payeeCategory3.description: User field to categorize the transaction.

payeeCategory2.description: User field to categorize the transaction.

payeeCategory1.description: User field to categorize the transaction.

dueDate.description:
Informational field indicating the date by when the payment is due.
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-dd)

expiryTime.description:
The expiry date and time of the resulting payment request token code. If not specified, then never expire.
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ).

amount.description:
Amount to generate the payment token for. The amount will be displayed to the token reader in order for payer to confirm. If omitted, the payer can populate their own amount.
(Format R.cc / R)

description.description: Description for the transaction. Will be displayed to the scanner of the QR code.

payeeRefInfo.description: Used to uniquely identify thetransaction for the applicable Member as usedinthe external system.

tokenImage.description: The resulting payment request token code image encoded in Base64 with dimensions as specified by payee.

status.description: The status of the token. See enum for valid values.

lastModified.description:
The date and time that the token request was last modified.
UTC Datetime with time zone
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

created.description:
The date and time that the token request was created.
UTC Datetime with time zone
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

uuid.description:
The unique reference used to identify the token request.
(UUID - ISO/IEC 9834-8:2014)

tokenid.description: The resulting payment request token code

allOf.title: Status
allOf.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

post.description: Generates a Trustlink Payment Network request. The token can be paid using CHIPS, Masterpass or any other Masterpass or Trustlink Payment Network capable aAp. The token can be presented as a QR code for scanning by these payment apps.

values.description: Listing of tokens matching the provided criteria

marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

get.description:
Calculate the fees the CHIPS® account holder will have to pay to transfer money to a bank account.

<!-- theme: warning -->
> ## Unique Bank Identification - use bankCode
> Currently, the universal/default branch codes do not identify banks uniquely. Most notable is both First National Bank and FirstRand Bank trading against the same branch code, but using different BIC codes. 
> 
> The API endpoints that relate to banking will take in branchCode as per the Quick Reference table below. Thus if 250655 is passed it will pick FNB. 
> 
> For better unique identification, user the GET /chips/money/banks endpoint to retrieve the bank code used by the CHIPS backend to identify the target bank.


*Quick Reference for Universal Branch Codes*

| Bank | Branch Codes |
| --- | --- |
|	Nedbank	|	198765	|
|	Absa Bank	|	632005	|
|	Capitec Bank	|	470010	|
|	Investec Bank	|	580105	|
|	Standard Bank	|	051001	|
|	First National Bank	|	250655	|

For the fees query you need to supply either the bankCode (preferred) or the branchCode.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount on which fees should be calculated

parameters.name: branchCode
parameters.description: Branch code indicating the bank involved.

parameters.name: bankCode
parameters.description: Bank code indicating the bank involved. (Preferred above branchCode)

allOf.title: CHIPS Bank Payment Response
allOf.description: Payload indicating deposit of funds into a bank account from the CHIPS Payment Platform.

bankRefInfo.description: External reference displayed on the payees bank statement

amount.description:
Amount that with bewithdrawn. Must be a multiple of R 
10

payerRefInfo.description: External reference to be displayed on the payers transaction history

Facilitates payments into bank accounts from a CHIPS account.

payerCategory1.description: Field to categorize the transaction from the Payer point of view.

payerCategory2.description: Field to categorize the transaction from the Payer point of view.

payerCategory3.description: Field to categorize the transaction from the Payer point of view.

paymentDate.description:
Informational field indicating the date by when the payment is due.
[Format ISO8601 i.e. yyyy-mm-dd]

allOf.title: CHIPS description for Payment Field
allOf.description: This field can be provided by the end user or by the integrator. It is free form, but does have special meaning in some payment contexts. For example, for a token based payment, the QR scanning app will display the description to the payer.

feeSponsorType.description:
Indicator of who is paying the fee for the transfer. 
- If PAYER, then the amount deducted from the PAYER is *amount + fee*. The PAYEE receives *amount*. 
- If PAYEE, then the aomunt deducted from the PAYER is *amount*. The PAYEE receives *amount - fee*

paymentType.description:
Type of payment 
* DEFAULT - wallet to wallet
* BULK - part of a bulk / multiple payments instruction
* CARD - processed via card transaction

status.description: The status of the token. See enum for valid values.

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

allOf.title: CHIPS Payment Input - Payee Details
allOf.description:
Model for the Payee fields of a CHIPS payment.
Please see details per end-point. In some cases the required fields and usage of fields might differ.

payeeAccountUuid.description: Payee account UUID in the CHIPS Payment Network. Searchable.

payeeRefInfo.description: A reference provided by the payee, application or external system to identify the purpose of the payment. Searchable.

payeeMessage.example: Please arrange delivery on a Friday

payeeSiteRefInfo.description: A reference provided by the application or external system to identify the specific business unit or paypoint.

payeeCategory1.description: Field to categorize the transaction from the Payee point of view.

payeeCategory2.description: Field to categorize the transaction from the Payee point of view.

payeeCategory3.description: Field to categorize the transaction from the Payee point of view.

payeeSiteName.description: A description provided by the application or external system to label the site where the payment originates.

siteName.description: See payeeSiteName. Field marked for deprecation.

payerAccountUuid.description: Payer account UUID in the CHIPS Payment Network. Searchable.

payerRefInfo.description: A reference provided by the payer, application or external system to identify the purpose of the payment. Searchable.

post.description: Send funds to CHIPS supported account

requestId.description:
The unique identifier used by the sender of the original request.
UUID (ISO/IEC 9834-8:201)

created.description:
The date and time when created.
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

createdByChannelUuid.description:
The unique identifier used for the steward/agent involved.
UUID (ISO/IEC 9834-8:201)

lastModified.description:
The date and time of the last update.
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

lastModifiedBy.description:
The user UUID of the last update.
(ISO/IEC 9834-8:201)

lastModifiedByChannelUuid.description:
The unique identifier used for the steward/agent involved.
UUID (ISO/IEC 9834-8:201)

reason.description: The reason given for the last update.

amount.description: The total amount requested by the payee, e.g. R5.23 = 5.23

deliveryIdentifier.description: The identifier of the delivery mechanism, i.e. '+12828049935' (mobile number)

deliveryType.description:
The delivery mechanism type.

Enum:
Array [ 4 ]

description.description: The description for the request of payment.

dueDate.description: The date by when payment is due.

expiryTime.description: The timestamp when the request for payment expires.

gratuityAmount.description: The amount included as gratuity, i.e. tip amount.

notifyUrl.description: The URL to which information will be send regarding the outcome of a transaction.

payeeAccountUuid.description:
The unique identifier of the account linked to the involved merchant.
(ISO/IEC 9834-8:201)

payeeRefInfo.description: The payee's internal reference for the request

payeeSiteName.description: A name used to identify the payee's business unit.

payeeSiteRefInfo.description: The unique reference used to identify the business unit's payment request.

payerAccountUuid.description: The account identifier (UUID) of a specific payer

payerCategory1.description: The payer's default classification category level 1

payerCategory2.description: The payer's default classification category level 2

payerCategory3.description: The payer's default classification category level 3

payerMessage.description: A message to the specified payer

requestDeposit.description: The indicator if the request is used to deposit funds.

requestPartialPayment.description: The indicator if a partial payment is allowed.

requestTip.description: The indicator if tips are allowed.

requestUseOnce.description:
The indicator if the request may only be used once,
for example an invoice request for payment, else it's a static request.

tokenId.description: The unique token used to identify the payment request.

tokenImage.description: The base64 QR-code of the token value.

status.description:
The status of the payment request.

Enum:
Array [ 6 ]

systemRefInfo.description: The internal unqiue reference used within the system.

parameters.name: createdFrom
parameters.description: Only include payment requests created after this date and time (ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

parameters.name: createdUntill
parameters.description: Only include payment requests created before this date and time (ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Available values : COMPLETED, EXPIRED, FAILED, PENDING, REJECTED, REVERSED

parameters.name: dueDate
parameters.description: Date when payment is due (ISO8601 yyyy-mm-dd)
Only include payment requests which expires after this date and time (ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)
parameters.name: expiryFrom
expiryUntil
parameters.description: Only include payment requests which expires before this date and time (ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of entries to include per page  Default value : 200

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order  Available values : ASC, DESC  Default value : ASC

get.description: Get one or more payment requests by criteria values

post.description: Create a request for payment that will settle to multiple payees.

description.description: User field to provide custom description for the request

currencyCode.description:
The currency in which the payment request amounts are specified
ISO 4217 currency codes to be used. Default = ZAR if not specified

amount.description: The total amount requested, excluding additional amount that could be specified when the actual payment is made

gratuityAmount.description: The amount included as gratuity, i.e. tip amount.

siteName.description: User field to identify the site that created the payment request

siteRefInfo.description: A reference used by the payee / external system to identify the specific business unit

options.description: Various options applicable to the payment request

informPayer.description: Inform the payer of the payment request if possible.

requestUseOnce.description: Used to specify if the resulting token can be used once or multiple times for payment

requestPartialPayment.description: Used to specify if the payable amount can be decreased in order to pay only a part of the total amount when specified

dueDate.description: Date by when payment must be completed. This is just used for information purposes to the payer

expiryTime.description: The expiry date and time of the resulting payment request token code. After this time, the payment request will not be available for payment and status will change to expired

paymentAllocationMethod.description: The method used to allocate the payment amount when multiple payees are specified

paymentMethods.description: The method used to allocate the payment amount when multiple payees are specified

creditCard.description: The indicator if CREDIT CARD payments are allowed/disallowed

debitCard.description: The indicator if DEBIT CARD payments are allowed/disallowed

instantEFT.description: The indicator if instant EFT payments are allowed/disallowed

chipsPmt.description: The indicator if CHIPS payments are allowed/disallowed

trident.description: The indicator if Trident payments are allowed/disallowed

masterpass.description: The indicator if MASTERPASS payments are allowed/disallowed

snapScan.description: The indicator if CASH DEPOSIT payments are allowed/disallowed

payat.description: Indicator to allow cash deposit payments at Pay@ participating retailer POS

accountUuid.description:
The unique identifier of the paeyr's account
(ISO/IEC 9834-8:201)

category1.description: A field used to categorize the transaction

category2.description: A field used to categorize the transaction

category3.description: A field used to categorize the transaction

refInfo.description: The unique reference of the transaction within the payee's external system

message.description: A custom message to the payer

email.description: The email address of the contact

mobileNumber.description:
The valid cell number of the contact
Pattern: ^((+[1-9]?[0-9])|0)?[6-9][0-9]{9}$

email.description: The email address of the contact

mobileNumber.description:
The valid cell number of the contact
Pattern: ^((+[1-9]?[0-9])|0)?[6-9][0-9]{9}$

state.description: The state or province of the city

countryCode.description:
The country code of this address
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes

email.description: The email address of the contact

mobileNumber.description:
The valid cell number of the contact
Pattern: ^((+[1-9]?[0-9])|0)?[6-9][0-9]{9}$

state.description: The state or province of the city

countryCode.description:
The country code of this address
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes

taxReferenceNumber.description: The tax reference number applicable to the entity being billed

items.description: Details per item of the goods or services
Details per item of the goods or services

code.description: The business identifier code for the product or service being purchased

description.description: The description of the product or service being purchased

quantity.description: Quantity of units of the product or service being purchased

unitPrice.description: Unit price of the product or service being purchased, excluding taxes.

exclTaxAmount.description: The line total for the product or service being purchased, excluding taxes

inclTaxAmount.description: The line total for the product or service being purchased, including taxes

taxAmount.description: The tax applicable to the line total for the product or service being purchased

total.description: Total of the goods or services

exclTaxAmount.description: The total for the product or service being purchased, excluding taxes

inclTaxAmount.description: The total for the product or service being purchased, including taxes

taxAmount.description: The tax applicable to the total for the product or service being purchased

payees.description: Details related to the payees (beneficiaries) of the payment related to the payment request

primary.description: The indicator if this is the PRIMARY payee

description.description: Description relevant to the payee for the involved payment request

accountUuid.description:
The unique identifier of the involved account
(ISO/IEC 9834-8:201)

category1.description: A field used to categorize the transaction

category2.description: A field used to categorize the transaction

category3.description: A field used to categorize the transaction

refInfo.description: The unique reference of the transaction within the payee's external system

message.description: A custom message to the payer

emails.description: The email address where email notification must be sent

mobileNumbers.description:
The mobile numbers where SMS notification must be sent
Pattern: ^((+[1-9]?[0-9])|0)?[6-9][0-9]{9}$

amount.description: The amount payable to the payee

amountPercentage.description: The percentage of the amount received when payment is made, excluding the additional amount received, that must be allocated to this payee

additionalAmountPercentage.description: The percentage of the additional amount received when payment is made that must be allocated to this payee

documentUrl.description:
The business defined URL to provide a link to an underlying document
for example, an order or invoice hosted on an external system

notifyUrl.description: The URL to which information will be send regarding the outcome of a transaction

methodType.description: This indicates the method used to allocate fees payable

accountUuid.description:
The account identifier for the member that is sponsoring the fee of the payment transaction(s)
(ISO/IEC 9834-8:201)

get.summary: Get Multi Payment Request by Token

requestId.description:
The unique identifier used by the sender of a request.
(Recommended UUID (ISO/IEC 9834-8:201))

tokenId.description: The token identifier allocated to the payment request.

expiryTime.description:
The expiry date and time of the payment token.
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

get.description: Get the payment request using the token ID

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: The token identifier allocated to the payment request

uuid.description:
The unique reference used to identify the token request.
(UUID - ISO/IEC 9834-8:2014)

created.description:
The date and time that the token request was created.
UTC Datetime with time zone
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

createdByChannelUuid.description: UUID of the authorization channel that issued the request.

lastModified.description:
The date and time that the token request was last modified.
UTC Datetime with time zone
(ISO8601 yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ)

payeeRefInfo.description: A reference provided by the payee, application or external system to identify the purpose of the payment. Searchable.

bankRefInfo.description: External reference to be displayed on the payees bank statement

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

post.description:
Allows CHIPS accounts to be funded via EFT from their bank account. The API provides an URL that needs to be launched to the CHIPS EFT processing partner.

## Testing Note

In testing environment the EFT amount must be one of the following
* R 99.83
* R 989.48
* R 99973.40

payeeAccountUuid.description: Payee account UUID in the Trustlink Payment Network. Searchable.

payeeRefInfo.description: A reference provided by the payee, application or external system to identify the purpose of the payment. Searchable.

bankRefInfo.description: External reference to be displayed on the payees bank statement

parameters.description: Amount on which fees should be calculated
parameters.name: amount

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

get.description: Retrieve business bank beneficiaries by UUID

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.
